Package tripleplay.ui

Class Scroller

java.lang.Object
tripleplay.ui.Element<T>
tripleplay.ui.Container<T>
tripleplay.ui.Composite<Scroller>
tripleplay.ui.Scroller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Element<?>>
public class Scroller extends Composite<Scroller>
A composite element that manages horizontal and vertical scrolling of a single content element. As shown below, the content can be thought of as moving around behind the scroll group, which is clipped to create a "view" to the content. Methods xpos() and ypos() allow reading the current position of the view. The view position can be set with scroll(float, float). The view size and content size are available via viewSize() and contentSize(). 

      Scrolled view (xpos,ypos>0)       View unscrolled (xpos,ypos=0)
     ---------------------------        ---------------------------
     |                :        |        | Scroll  |               |
     |   content      : ypos   |        | Group   |               |
     |                :        |        |  "view" |               |
     |           -----------   |        |----------               |
     |           | Scroll  |   |        |                         |
     |---xpos--->| Group   |   |        |                         |
     |           |  "view" |   |        |         content         |
     |           -----------   |        |                         |
     ---------------------------        ---------------------------

Scroll bars are configurable via the BAR_TYPE style.

NOTE: Scroller is a composite container, so callers can't add to or remove from it. To "add" elements, callers should set content to a Group and add things to it instead.

NOTE: scrolling is done by pointer events; there are two ways to provide interactive (clickable) content.

  • The first way is to pass bubble=true to Pointer.Dispatcher's constructor. This allows any descendants within the content to be clicked normally. With this approach, after the pointer has been dragged more than a minimum distance, the Scroller calls Interaction.capture(), which will cancel all other pointer interactions, including clickable descendants. For buttons or toggles, this causes the element to be deselected, corresponding to popular mobile OS conventions.
  • The second way is to use the contentClicked() signal. This is more lightweight but only emits after the pointer is released less than a minimum distance away from its starting position.
TODO: some way to handle keyboard events (complicated by lack of a focus element) TODO: more fine-grained setPropagateEvents (add a flag to playn Layer?) TODO: temporarily allow drags past the min/max scroll positions and bounce back

    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Scroller.Bars
    Handles the appearance and animation of scroll bars.
    static class 
    Scroller.BarType
    Handles creating the scroll bars.
    static enum 
    Scroller.Behavior
    Defines the directions available for scrolling.
    static interface 
    Scroller.Clippable
    Interface for customizing how content is clipped and translated.
    static interface 
    Scroller.Listener
    Listens for changes to the scrolling area or offset.
    static class 
    Scroller.Range
    A range along an axis for representing scroll bars.
    static class 
    Scroller.TouchBars
    Plain rectangle scroll bars that overlay the content area, consume no additional screen space, and fade out after inactivity.

  • Field Details

    • BAR_TYPE

      public static final Style<Scroller.BarType> BAR_TYPE
      The type of bars to use. By default, uses an instance of Scroller.TouchBars.

    • ELEMENT_BUFFER

      public static final Style<pythagoras.f.IDimension> ELEMENT_BUFFER
      The buffer around a child element when updating visibility (updateVisibility(). The default value (0x0) causes any elements whose exact bounds lie outside the clipped area to be culled. If elements are liable to have overhanging layers, the value can be set larger appropriately.

    • content

      public final Element<?> content
      The content contained in the scroller.

    • hrange

      public final Scroller.Range hrange
      Scroll ranges.

    • vrange

      public final Scroller.Range vrange
      Scroll ranges.

    • flicker

      public final XYFlicker flicker
      Handles the flicking physics.

  • Constructor Details

    • Scroller

      public Scroller(Element<?> content)
      Creates a new scroller containing the given content and with Scroller.Behavior.BOTH.

      If the content is an instance of Scroller.Clippable, then translation will occur via that interface. Otherwise, the content's layer translation will be set directly. Graphics level clipping is always performed.

  • Method Details

    • findScrollParent

      public static Scroller findScrollParent(Element<?> elem)
      Finds the closest ancestor of the given element that is a Scroller, or null if there isn't one. This uses the tripleplay ui hierarchy.

    • makeVisible

      public static boolean makeVisible(Element<?> elem)
      Attempts to scroll the given element into view.
      Returns:
      true if successful

    • setBehavior

      public Scroller setBehavior(Scroller.Behavior beh)
      Sets the behavior of this scroller.

    • addListener

      public void addListener(Scroller.Listener lner)
      Adds a listener to be notified of this scroller's changes.

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener(Scroller.Listener lner)
      Removes a previously added listener from this scroller.

    • xpos

      public float xpos()
      Returns the offset of the left edge of the view area relative to that of the content.

    • ypos

      public float ypos()
      Returns the offset of the top edge of the view area relative to that of the content.

    • scrollX

      public void scrollX(float x)
      Sets the left edge of the view area relative to that of the content. The value is clipped to be within its valid range.

    • scrollY

      public void scrollY(float y)
      Sets the top edge of the view area relative to that of the content. The value is clipped to be within its valid range.

    • scroll

      public void scroll(float x, float y)
      Sets the left and top of the view area relative to that of the content. The values are clipped to be within their respective valid ranges.

    • queueScroll

      public void queueScroll(float x, float y)
      Sets the left and top of the view area relative to that of the content the next time the container is laid out. This is needed if the caller invalidates the content and needs to then set a scroll position which may be out of range for the old size.

    • contentSize

      public pythagoras.f.IDimension contentSize()
      Gets the size of the content that we are responsible for scrolling. Scrolling is active for a given axis when this is larger than viewSize() along that axis.

    • viewSize

      public pythagoras.f.IDimension viewSize()
      Gets the size of the view which renders some portion of the content.

    • contentClicked

      public react.Signal<Pointer.Event> contentClicked()
      Gets the signal dispatched when a pointer click occurs in the scroller. This happens only when the drag was not far enough to cause appreciable scrolling.
